node.title: COVID-19 world latest: Netherlands 'heading straight for disaster', WHO warns of syringe shortage
node.description: Here's the latest from around the world overnight.
node.content: ["Here's the latest from around the world overnight.", "UK", "Health workers in England will have to be vaccinated against COVID-19 by April 1, health minister Sajid Javid said on Tuesday, making it a mandatory condition of employment for those on the frontline of the National Health Service. There are around 100,000 health workers who are yet to have their first shot, Javid said.", "Britain reported 262 new deaths within 28 days of a positive COVID-19 test on Tuesday, up from 57 a day earlier, while the total death toll for the past seven days was 1160, up 2.6 percent on the previous seven days, official data showed.", "Italy", "Italy reported 68 coronavirus-related deaths on Tuesday against 32 the day before, the health ministry said. It reported 6032 new infections, up from 4,197 a day earlier.", "Netherlands", "A group of hospitals in the southern Dutch province of Limburg on Tuesday called for the Government to take new measures to stem rising COVID-19 cases, saying they have no space or staff to handle more coronavirus patients.", "Coronavirus infections in the Netherlands, as in other parts of Europe, are approaching all-time highs despite adult vaccination levels around 85 percent.", "\"We are heading straight for a healthcare disaster and the whole system is becoming jammed,\" the five hospitals in Limburg said.", "Russia", "The government coronavirus taskforce reported a record one-day death toll of 1211 and reported 39,160 new cases in the last 24 hours, down from a peak of 41,335 on Saturday.", "Ukraine", "Ukraine registered a record 833 coronavirus-related deaths over the past 24 hours, the health ministry said on Tuesday.", "Germany", "Germany's infection rate has risen to its highest level since the start of the pandemic, and doctors warned they will need to postpone scheduled operations to cope.", "Australia", "Unvaccinated people are 16 times more likely to end up in intensive care units or die from COVID-19, Australia's New South Wales state said in a report, with officials urging people to get inoculated as Australia begins to live with the coronavirus.", "Thailand", "Thailand plans to reopen its borders to workers from neighbouring Myanmar, Cambodia and Laos, a government official said on Tuesday, in a bid to ease a labour shortage that is hurting its export and tourism-dependent economy.", "Singapore", "A Singapore court stayed the execution of a Malaysian convicted of drug smuggling for reasons of \"common sense and humanity\" after confirming he had tested positive for COVID-19, a day before he was due to be hanged.", "Canada", "Health Canada on Tuesday authorised the use of a booster dose of the Pfizer and BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for people aged 18 years and older.", "US", "The seven-day rolling average of deaths has dropped 15 percent in the last week to 1226.", "Mexico", "There were fewer crossings at the Mexico-United States border than expected on Monday as it reopened to nonessential travel following a 20-month closure due to the COVID-19 pandemic, with many residents staying home to avoid potential chaos.", "France's public health authority has recommended people under 30 be given Pfizer's Comirnaty COVID-19 vaccine when available instead of Moderna's Spikevax jab, which carried comparatively higher risks of heart-related problems. However, according to the EMA, the benefits of both mRNA shots in preventing COVID-19 continue to outweigh the risks.", "There could be a shortage of 1 to 2 billion syringes needed to administer COVID-19 vaccinations in 2022 which could also impact routine immunisations and undermine needle safety, the World Health Organization warned on Tuesday.", "AstraZeneca is creating a separate division for vaccines and antibody therapies, the drugmaker said on Tuesday, to focus on its COVID-19 shot and the development of coronavirus treatments after a series of setbacks during the pandemic.", "The US government will buy another US$1 billion worth of the COVID-19 pill made by Merck and partner Ridgeback Biotherapeutics, the companies said on Tuesday.", "The European Union drugs regulator is set to authorise the use of two monoclonal antibodies to treat COVID-19 patients in coming days, two EU sources told Reuters, in its first approvals of such therapies.", "India could resume deliveries of COVID-19 shots to global vaccine-sharing platform COVAX in a few weeks for the first time since April, two health industry sources said, ending a suspension of supplies that has hurt poor countries.", "Britain said it would recognise COVID-19 vaccines on the World Health Organization's Emergency Use Listing later this month, adding China's Sinovac, Sinopharm and India's Covaxin to the country's approved list of vaccines for inbound travellers.", "Reuters / Newshub."]
